trans-unit.source: The task identifier.
trans-unit.target: The task identifier.

trans-unit.source: Another task this task depends on.
trans-unit.target: Another task this task depends on.

trans-unit.source: The other tasks this task depends on.
trans-unit.target: The other tasks this task depends on.

trans-unit.source: Either a string representing another task or an array of other tasks that this task depends on.
trans-unit.target: Either a string representing another task or an array of other tasks that this task depends on.

trans-unit.source: Run all dependsOn tasks in parallel.
trans-unit.target: Run all dependsOn tasks in parallel.

trans-unit.source: Run all dependsOn tasks in sequence.
trans-unit.target: Run all dependsOn tasks in sequence.

trans-unit.source: Determines the order of the dependsOn tasks for this task. Note that this property is not recursive.
trans-unit.target: Determines the order of the dependsOn tasks for this task. Note that this property is not recursive.

trans-unit.source: An optional description of a task that shows in the Run Task quick pick as a detail.
trans-unit.target: An optional description of a task that shows in the Run Task quick pick as a detail.

trans-unit.source: Configures the panel that is used to present the task's output and reads its input.
trans-unit.target: Configures the panel that is used to present the task's output and reads its input.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the executed command is echoed to the panel. Default is true.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the executed command is echoed to the panel. Default is true.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the panel takes focus. Default is false. If set to true the panel is revealed as well.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the panel takes focus. Default is false. If set to true the panel is revealed as well.

trans-unit.source: Always reveals the problems panel when this task is executed.
trans-unit.target: Always reveals the problems panel when this task is executed.

trans-unit.source: Only reveals the problems panel if a problem is found.
trans-unit.target: Only reveals the problems panel if a problem is found.

trans-unit.source: Never reveals the problems panel when this task is executed.
trans-unit.target: Never reveals the problems panel when this task is executed.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the problems panel is revealed when running this task or not. Takes precedence over option "reveal". Default is "never".
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the problems panel is revealed when running this task or not. Takes precedence over option "reveal". Default is "never".

trans-unit.source: Always reveals the terminal when this task is executed.
trans-unit.target: Always reveals the terminal when this task is executed.

trans-unit.source: Only reveals the terminal if the task exits with an error or the problem matcher finds an error.
trans-unit.target: Only reveals the terminal if the task exits with an error or the problem matcher finds an error.

trans-unit.source: Never reveals the terminal when this task is executed.
trans-unit.target: Never reveals the terminal when this task is executed.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the terminal running the task is revealed or not. May be overridden by option "revealProblems". Default is "always".
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the terminal running the task is revealed or not. May be overridden by option "revealProblems". Default is "always".

trans-unit.source: Controls if the panel is shared between tasks, dedicated to this task or a new one is created on every run.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the panel is shared between tasks, dedicated to this task or a new one is created on every run.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether to show the `Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it` message.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether to show the `Terminal will be reused by tasks, press any key to close it` message.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the terminal is cleared before executing the task.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the terminal is cleared before executing the task.

trans-unit.source: Controls whether the task is executed in a specific terminal group using split panes.
trans-unit.target: Controls whether the task is executed in a specific terminal group using split panes.

trans-unit.source: The terminal property is deprecated. Use presentation instead
trans-unit.target: The terminal property is deprecated. Use presentation instead

trans-unit.source: The task's execution group.
trans-unit.target: The task's execution group.

trans-unit.source: Defines if this task is the default task in the group.
trans-unit.target: Defines if this task is the default task in the group.

trans-unit.source: Marks the task as the default build task.
trans-unit.target: Marks the task as the default build task.

trans-unit.source: Marks the task as the default test task.
trans-unit.target: Marks the task as the default test task.

trans-unit.source: Marks the task as a build task accessible through the 'Run Build Task' command.
trans-unit.target: Marks the task as a build task accessible through the 'Run Build Task' command.

trans-unit.source: Marks the task as a test task accessible through the 'Run Test Task' command.
trans-unit.target: Marks the task as a test task accessible through the 'Run Test Task' command.

trans-unit.source: Assigns the task to no group
trans-unit.target: Assigns the task to no group

trans-unit.source: Defines to which execution group this task belongs to. It supports "build" to add it to the build group and "test" to add it to the test group.
trans-unit.target: Defines to which execution group this task belongs to. It supports "build" to add it to the build group and "test" to add it to the test group.

trans-unit.source: Defines whether the task is run as a process or as a command inside a shell.
trans-unit.target: Defines whether the task is run as a process or as a command inside a shell.

trans-unit.source: The shell command to be executed. Array items will be joined using a space character
trans-unit.target: The shell command to be executed. Array items will be joined using a space character

trans-unit.source: The actual command value
trans-unit.target: The actual command value

trans-unit.source: Escapes characters using the shell's escape character (e.g. ` under PowerShell and \ under bash).
trans-unit.target: Escapes characters using the shell's escape character (e.g. ` under PowerShell and \ under bash).

trans-unit.source: Quotes the argument using the shell's strong quote character (e.g. " under PowerShell and bash).
trans-unit.target: Quotes the argument using the shell's strong quote character (e.g. " under PowerShell and bash).

trans-unit.source: Quotes the argument using the shell's weak quote character (e.g. ' under PowerShell and bash).
trans-unit.target: Quotes the argument using the shell's weak quote character (e.g. ' under PowerShell and bash).

trans-unit.source: How the command value should be quoted.
trans-unit.target: How the command value should be quoted.

trans-unit.source: The command to be executed. Can be an external program or a shell command.
trans-unit.target: The command to be executed. Can be an external program or a shell command.

trans-unit.target: The actual argument value

trans-unit.target: How the argument value should be quoted.

trans-unit.target: Arguments passed to the command when this task is invoked.

trans-unit.target: The task's user interface label

trans-unit.source: Whether to reevaluate task variables on rerun.
trans-unit.target: Whether to reevaluate task variables on rerun.

trans-unit.target: Configures when the task should be run. If set to folderOpen, then the task will be run automatically when the folder is opened.

trans-unit.target: Whether the executed task is kept alive and is running in the background.

trans-unit.target: Whether the user is prompted when VS Code closes with a running task.

trans-unit.target: The problem pattern is invalid. The kind property must be provided only in the first element

trans-unit.source: The problem pattern is invalid. It must have at least have a file and a message.
trans-unit.target: The problem pattern is invalid. It must have at least have a file and a message.

trans-unit.source: The problem pattern is invalid. It must either have kind: "file" or have a line or location match group.
trans-unit.target: The problem pattern is invalid. It must either have kind: "file" or have a line or location match group.

trans-unit.source: Error: The string {0} is not a valid regular expression.
trans-unit.target: Error: The string {0} is not a valid regular expression.

trans-unit.source: The regular expression to find an error, warning or info in the output.
trans-unit.target: The regular expression to find an error, warning or info in the output.

trans-unit.source: whether the pattern matches a location (file and line) or only a file.
trans-unit.target: whether the pattern matches a location (file and line) or only a file.

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the filename. If omitted 1 is used.
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the filename. If omitted 1 is used.

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the problem's location. Valid location patterns are: (line), (line,column) and (startLine,startColumn,endLine,endColumn). If omitted (line,column) is assumed.
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the problem's location. Valid location patterns are: (line), (line,column) and (startLine,startColumn,endLine,endColumn). If omitted (line,column) is assumed.

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the problem's line. Defaults to 2
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the problem's line. Defaults to 2

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the problem's line character. Defaults to 3
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the problem's line character. Defaults to 3

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the problem's end line. Defaults to undefined
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the problem's end line. Defaults to undefined

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the problem's end line character. Defaults to undefined
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the problem's end line character. Defaults to undefined

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the problem's severity. Defaults to undefined
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the problem's severity. Defaults to undefined

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the problem's code. Defaults to undefined
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the problem's code. Defaults to undefined

trans-unit.source: The match group index of the message. If omitted it defaults to 4 if location is specified. Otherwise it defaults to 5.
trans-unit.target: The match group index of the message. If omitted it defaults to 4 if location is specified. Otherwise it defaults to 5.

trans-unit.source: In a multi line matcher loop indicated whether this pattern is executed in a loop as long as it matches. Can only specified on a last pattern in a multi line pattern.
trans-unit.target: In a multi line matcher loop indicated whether this pattern is executed in a loop as long as it matches. Can only specified on a last pattern in a multi line pattern.

trans-unit.target: The name of a contributed or predefined pattern

trans-unit.source: A problem pattern or the name of a contributed or predefined problem pattern. Can be omitted if base is specified.
trans-unit.target: A problem pattern or the name of a contributed or predefined problem pattern. Can be omitted if base is specified.

trans-unit.source: The name of a base problem matcher to use.
trans-unit.target: The name of a base problem matcher to use.

trans-unit.source: The owner of the problem inside Code. Can be omitted if base is specified. Defaults to 'external' if omitted and base is not specified.
trans-unit.target: The owner of the problem inside Code. Can be omitted if base is specified. Defaults to 'external' if omitted and base is not specified.

trans-unit.source: A human-readable string describing the source of this diagnostic, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'.
trans-unit.target: A human-readable string describing the source of this diagnostic, e.g. 'typescript' or 'super lint'.

trans-unit.source: The default severity for captures problems. Is used if the pattern doesn't define a match group for severity.
trans-unit.target: The default severity for captures problems. Is used if the pattern doesn't define a match group for severity.

trans-unit.source: Controls if a problem reported on a text document is applied only to open, closed or all documents.
trans-unit.target: Controls if a problem reported on a text document is applied only to open, closed or all documents.

trans-unit.source: Defines how file names reported in a problem pattern should be interpreted.

trans-unit.target: Patterns to track the begin and end of a matcher active on a background task.

trans-unit.source: If set to true the background monitor is in active mode when the task starts. This is equals of issuing a line that matches the beginsPattern
